comment:
QA PRE-REVIEW: CR-099 v0.1 -- RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "CAPA-002/003: Dual-Template Architecture Procedural Controls" -- present, descriptive
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" -- appropriate for v0.1

STRUCTURAL COMPLIANCE (SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present:
- Sections 1-9 (pre-approved): Purpose, Scope (2.1-2.3), Current State, Proposed State, Change Description (5.1-5.2), Justification, Impact Assessment (7.1-7.3), Testing Summary, Implementation Plan (9.1-9.4)
- Sections 10-12 (execution): EI table (4 items with VR column), Execution Comments, Execution Summary, References

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
- No draft placeholders ({{...}}) remain
- Execution placeholders ([SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], etc.) correctly present
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found

PARENT TRACEABILITY:
- Parent Document: INV-013 (CAPA-002, CAPA-003) -- explicitly stated in Section 2.1
- Bundling rationale documented in Execution Comments section

CONTENT ASSESSMENT:
- Section 5.1 (CAPA-002): TEMPLATE-CR usage guide addition clearly described with 4 specific content areas. Well-scoped.
- Section 5.2 (CAPA-003): SOP-002 Section 7.3 addition concisely specified. Verified that current SOP-002 Section 7.3 does not contain template alignment verification, consistent with Current State description.
- CAPA bundling is justified: both address related procedural gaps in the same change control workflow.
- 4 EIs are proportionate to scope: pre-execution, TEMPLATE-CR update, SOP-002 update, post-execution.
- Defense-in-depth rationale (author guidance + QA verification) is sound preventive design.

FORMATTING: Clean and consistent throughout. Tables, section numbering, markdown all correct.

TU ASSIGNMENT: None needed. Purely procedural document updates with no code or domain-specific content.
